main event: A round yellow-white ball, three-fourths the size of a full moon and as bright as the moon, was observed traveling roughly southwest to northeast over Phoenix, Arizona.
interesting points: The object changed direction sharply without slowing down and disappeared perfectly round.
The object was between the observer and the White Tank Mountains at an estimated altitude of 3,500 feet.
The witness was a pilot and the observation was made during a training mission.
Weather conditions at the time included clear skies, good visibility, and calm winds.
Several similar sightings of bright, fast-moving objects were reported in the Phoenix area around this time.
sighted object: round yellow-white ball, three-fourths size of full moon
